description: A metadata record has two sections, one with information for management of the metadata itself, and one that describes some individual resource. Each metadata record describes exactly one resource. The metadata record can be considered a representation of the resource, but it has an identity that is distinct from the identity of the described resource.  There may be more than one metadata record in the system describing a single resource, these should have distinct metadata lineages. specifications followed here-  JSON pointer--http: tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6901; JSON schema Core--http://tools.ietf.org/html/draft-zyp-json-schema-04; JSON schema validation--http://tools.ietf.org/html/draft-fge-json-schema-validation-00. Some integration of JSON-LD, more to come hopefully... http://www.w3.org/TR/json-ld/. FOAF for person, organization--http://xmlns.com/foaf/spec/. DCAT--http://www.w3.org/TR/vocab-dcat/, and DublinCore--http://dublincore.org/documents/dcmi-terms/. still need to do integration work figuring out how to link elements in this metadata vocabulary with the other schemes.
skos:HistoryNote: 2015-10-09, add /2.0 to schema element base URI, review; make metadataSpecification id the spec for the metadata instance, not the harvestedsource; still need to set upreferences to the objects defined in the definitions section. Revise so will validate with http://www.jsonschemavalidator.net/ and http://jsonschemalint.com/draft4/# using the draft 4 version of the json schema schema. Note that http://www.jsonschemavalidator.net/ cannot process this schema to use to validate instance docs. Jsonschemlint.com will work to validate instances.

jmd:metadataRecordURI.description: unique identifier for the metadata record (as distinct from the resource it describes)

jmd:metadataUpdateDate.description: exactly 1. This is time stamp for most recent change to metadata content in this record. Update history should be in metadataLineage; this is a convienence property

jmd:metadataContacts.description: contact information to report problems with the resource description content. jmd:metadataContacts maps to ISO19115 metadataContact

jmd:metadataSpecification.description: Identifies the specification & profile for this metadata instance. Instances of this json schema should be identified using the id property of this schema

jmd:metadataMaintenance.description: this element provides information on metadata maintenance process, interval or frequency. See metadataLineage for documentation of changes to the metadata record.

jmd:maintenanceNote.description: free text information about maintenance plans, workflow, process...

jmd:maintenanceInterval.description: time interval between planned maintenance events e.g. 6 months

jmd:metadataLanguage.description: Language of metadata content. Default is eng if no value is specified.

jmd:metadataRecordLineageItems.description: documentation of update history for this metadata record. An array of processing steps or a link to an external provenance trace.

jmd:metadataConformanceTests.description: an array of test names and results, used to indicate quality of record

jmd:conformanceTestDate.description: time stamp for when the test was run

jmd:conformanceTestNote.description: output from conformance test; if test fails this should provide information about what went wrong

jmd:metadataUsageConstraint.description: documentation of any restrictions on access to or usage of the metadata record.

jmd:harvestedMetadataFormat.description: Identifies the specification & profile of the source metadata harvested to construct this metadata object

jmd:collections.description: list of collection identifiers that this resource is a member of

jmd:published.description: true if the metadata record should be visible in the catalog; probably need to generalize to a policy object (like Fedora) to allow more granular access control

jmd:describedResource.description: exactly 1. what the metadata record is about

jmd:ResourceDescription.description: metadata that documents a resource. Basic requirement is title and access information to support the most basic discovery scenarios. The various optional elements provide capabilities for extensive resource documentation and inforamtion for machine interoperability.

jmd:resourceTitle.description: Title that identifies the resource for human users. Ideally the title would be unique to the described resource.

jmd:resourceDescription.description: Free text description of the resource. May summarize intellectual content, as well as describe various metadata aspects such as physical expression, lineage, quality, use constraints, maintenance.

jmd:resourceIdentifiers.description: Array of scoped identifiers with an optional authority associated with each identifier. Scoped Identifier(s) for the resource, e.g. ISBN, ISSN, Dewey Decimal system numbers, or other URIs determined by the publishing authority.

jmd:resourceURI.description: identifier string that conforms to RFC 3986. If identifier uses different syntax or conveintions use scopedIdetifier. Unique identifier conforming to IETF URI syntax (RFC 3986). Resource may have multiple identifiers; the identifier in this element is the preferred identifier recommended by the resource steward. The resourceURI is intended to identify the resource at the FRBR work level.

jmd:scopedIdentifier.description: identifierCodespace + identifierCodeString should be a globally unique combination.

jmd:identifierCodespace.description: string that together with code string is intended to generate a globally unique identifier string; like a namespace

jmd:scopedIdentifierAuthority.description: an identifier for the authority or identifier scheme within which the citationIdentifier is defined, if that authority is not uniquely identified by the identifier string itself (e.g. a prefix like 'doi:').

jmd:citationResponsibleParties.description: Citation information for the resource:  contributing agents (author, publisher, editor, compiler, etc.,  intellectual originator and contributors to content and presentation of the resource that metadata record describes.

jmd:citationDates.description: pertinent dates that may be useful in searches for the resource or for identifying it,Each date should scope a different origin event

jmd:citationAlternateTitles.description: alternate titles by which the resource may be known

jmd:citationRecommendation.description: a suggested full text citation to use when citing the resource; include standard bibliographic content like edition, publisher, series title, series issue, page numbers, other information appropriate to the described resource. a recommended full citation text to use for citing the resource.

jmd:citationDetails.description: Information to identify and locate published resources for which a formal bibliographic reference is appropriate. If the resource is a published work, other standard bibliographic information goes here. Publication details will only apply if the described resource is an frbr:manifestation or frbr:item (see https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Functional_Requirements_for_Bibliographic_Records). Linkage to online items should still be through distribution linkage elements.If the resource is a work or manifestation,then expressions and items will be distributions of that resource. Tricky...

jmd:series.description: identifier (with other reference properties that specifies the series within which the described resource is published, e.d.g a DOI for the journal

jmd:seriesIssue.description: identifier for issue in series; syntax should follow some bibliographic standard, but depends somewhat on the kind of series.

jmd:publicationDescription.description: free text with other details specific to this particular manifestation of the resource. might add physicalDistribution and physical extent (dimensions) elements here for library usage...

jmd:resourceTypes.description: 0..N.  ResourceType is a specially recognized keywordTheme that categorizes the resource; at least one type category should be specified, as the type will guide processing of other parts of the metadata record. Resource categorization can be done on many axes. Some example schemes include  Functional Requirements for Bibliographic Records (FRBR) entity, which include _work_,_expression_,_manifestation_, and _item_ (see http: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Functional_Requirements_for_Bibliographic_Records#FRBR_Entities), frbr form here as well ( e.g., novel, play, poem, essay, biography, symphony, concerto, sonata, map, drawing, painting, photograph, etc.), ISO scopeCodes that type resources. The different category schmes can be disambiguated by their VocabularyURI values, but concepts in each should have URIs that are sufficient.

jmd:resourceStatus.description: Term that specifies the development status of the resource (in review, published, draft....)

jmd:resourceContacts.description: link to party to contact for additional information about the resource. Each relatedAgent has an associated role; various parties may be associated with the resource in different roles.

jmd:resourceBrowseGraphic.description: Link to a graphic resource that provides a visualization of the resource.

jmd:resourceTemporalExtents.description: This is the time instant or interval to which the resource content applies. Extent using named time ordinal eras (e.g. geologic time) should be specified using temporal keywords (vocabulary is a time scale). use ISO8601 encoding for intervals with the format <start>/<end> where start and end are 8601 dateTime strings. see http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601

items.description: each extent array element is only one of an instant, a period, or a reference

jmd:timeInstantId.description: A unique identifier for the timeInstant.

jmd:timeInstantDescription.description: A brief description providing relevant information about the date and time.

jmd:timePeriod.description: A span of time represented by a starting date-time and an ending date-time.

jmd:timePeriodId.description: A unique identifier for a time period.

jmd:timePeriodDescription.description: A brief description providing relevant information about the time period.

jmd:timePeriodBeginPosition.description: Starting date, or date and time.

jmd:timePeriodEndPosition.description: Ending date, or date and time.

jmd:temporalExtentReference.description: reference to a temporal extent defined in some register

jmd:resourceCharacterEncoding.description: character set for described resource content

jmd:resourceLanguages.description: Language of resource content. Multiple languages may be specified. Use Nil not applicable if there is no text in the resource. Use ISO three letter language code (Each language SHOULD be expressed as a language tag, as defined by RFC 3066); provide option to use a jmd:reference if need some other kind of language scoping to a particulr community, dialect, or country

jmd:resourceSpatialExtents.description: specification of the geographic footprint of the described resource content.  Array allow multiple extents for non contiguous resource, e.g. map of US coasts, and ExtentObject allows various representations of extent.

jmd:resourceSpatialDescription.description: Properties characterizing the spatial aspects of the resource, if applicable.

jmd:resourceSpatialRepresentationType.description: term specifying the nature of the geometric representation, e.g. vector, grid, tin, voxel. More complete information on spatial representation (like ISO19115 spatial representation package) is not included here; use extensions in the description details group

jmd:resourceSpatialReferenceSystem.description: identifier and link to definition of spatial reference system used for location information contained in the resource content.

jmd:resourceIndexTerms.description: an array of objects, each of which is a set of keywords scoped to a particular keywordType or keywordReference value. Only one object in the array should have neither keywordType or keywordReference, and keywords in this element will be treated as free-form tags.

jmd:keywordType.description: Categorize this group of keywords; corresponds to CSDGM and ISO19115 theme. Typical values: include place, temporal, thematic, ISO topic category etc...

jmd:keywords.description: words associated with the resource to improve search accuracy. if no keywordReference is provided, these will be treated as tags. The keyword reference should provide a mapping from the labels that appear as strings in the keywords array here to URIs that uniquely identify the keyword (if such URIs are defined)

jmd:keywordReference.description: identifies a thesaurus, controlled vocabulary, ontology, etc. in which the assigned keywords are defined for people and/or machines

jmd:resourceAccessOptions.description: describes how to access the resource described by the metadata. Corresponds to ISO19115 distribution. Each object in the accessOptions array contains the offerings from a particular distributor. If no distributor is specified, assume that the resource contact is the distributor.

jmd:availableDateTimes.description: identify dates or date ranges where there may be restrictions on access. 'event' term on each date should make it clear what the restriction is, e.g.  business hours ,  offline for maintenance ,  discontinued after...

jmd:distributor.description: agent responsible for making the resources accessible at the associated URLs or offline locations

jmd:accessLinks.description: online location that provides some kind of access to the described resource. The link properties are used to characterize the nature of the resource at the specified location, e.g. if only particular spatial representation or spatial reference system types.

jmd:offlineAccess.description: information describing offline distribution, involving some sort of physical media

jmd:accessInstructions.description: free text description of how to get resource;  Include turnaround time and business hours information, turnaround time, and any other necessary information, including density, density units, number of volumes, software or hardware requirements, etc.

jmd:offlineMediumType.description: specification of the physical media that contains the distribution of the resource. This may be one of a variety of digital media (magnetic tape, hard disk, CDROM, DVD, thumb drive), or various legacy physical media (paper sheet, book, film transparency, rock specimen...)

jmd:offlineMediumFormat.description: Medium format is used in this scheme to specify the low-level formatting of information on a physical media.

jmd:offlineFileFormat.description: File format is used in this scheme to specify file formatting analogoous to mime type for offline distributions. Formats are typically associated with particular applications that can open the file (e.g. .doc, .xls) or are generic file types that can be opened by various applicaitons (e.g. text, tiff, csv...). Specific community profiles are necessary to specify the syntax and vocabulary for file format information.

jmd:fees.description: text explanation of any payment required to access resource

jmd:resourceLineageItems.description: Lineage documents the provenance of the described resource, includes a summary statement and a collection of processing steps ordered by a sequence property; based on ISO19115 lineage

jmd:resourceMaintenance.description: only one here, because particular maintainence events that update the resource should be recorded in the lineage. This element provides information on how often maintenance is expected to occur and who is doing the maintenance. The resource maintenance contact will be the point of contact for reporting issues with the resource content.

jmd:relatedResources.description: links to related resources. The relation property on the link defines the association type, and the link label provides the related resource name

jmd:resourceDetails.description: container for extension objects that define resource or domain-specific properties. Some basic examples are provided here

jmd:service.description: if metadata record is about a service, details of service operation are included here. Note that if the metadata record is about a dataset, access to the data set through a service is indicated through the accessOptions section of the metadata.

jmd:MaintenanceObject.description: Information about the maintenance plan and schedule for a resource. If the resource is updated, a process step in Lineage should be added.

jmd:maintenanceContacts.description: contact information for the agent responsible for maintenance of the resource

jmd:maintenanceNote.description: free text information about maintenance plans, workflow, process...note that individual maintenance events shuold be recorded in the resource Lineage (if they affect the described resource) or in the metadata history (if they affect the metadata record.

jmd:maintenanceInterval.description: time interval between planned maintenance events e.g. 6 months

jmd:stepLabel.description: text to characterize,identify this step for user interface listing

jmd:stepProcessDescription.description: free text description of what processing was done

jmd:stepInputResources.description: reference that identifies the resource(s) that are input into the process step

jmd:stepOutputResources.description: reference that identifies the resource(s) that are output from the process step

jmd:stepDateTimes.description: allow array, may have beginning, end, intermediate times...

jmd:stepRationale.description: discussion of why the process step was done

jmd:processParameterValue.description: parameter value; profiles will need to define syntax for encoding units and non-scalar parameter values

jmd:stepProcessExtents.description: 0..N  scope process to a particular geographic location/locations. Only applicable to geospatial located dataset

jmd:stepAffectedElements.description: references that identify dataset, entity, attribute instances affected by this process step

jmd:qualityScope.description: identifies the part of the resource that the quality assessment applies to. This allows quality statements scoped to the entire resource, some spatial extent within the extent covered by the resource, or to particular entities (records, features) within a collection resource. Optional, default is dataset.

jmd:qualityResultScopeItems.description: list of references to items that the result applies to

jmd:qualityStatement.description: free text assessment of resource quality, including quantitative and qualitative measures. Abstract of a standaloneQualityReport should be included here.

jmd:qualityReportReference.description: reference that identifies a quality report document

jmd:QualityReportObject.description: a collection of quality elements that apply to the specified scope.

jmd:qualityElementType.description: good starting point for this vocabulary is the subtypes of DQ_Element in ISO 19157: Completeness, conceptualConsistency, DomainConsistency, formatConsistency, topologicalConsistency,ThematicAccuracy, TemporalQuality, PositionalAccuracy (and subtypes of these...)

jmd:qualityElementConfidence.description: general statement of confidence in this quality element assessment, guessing what the intention in 19157 is supposed to be

jmd:qualityElementHomogeneity.description: how uniformly this element value applies across the assigned result scope

jmd:qualityElementRepresentativity.description: degree to which the sample used has produced a result which is representative of the data within the data quality scope

jmd:qualityMeasureIdentifier.description: Identifier of the measure, value uniquely identifying the measure within a namespace

jmd:qualityMeasureLabel.description: Text label for users to understand measure type

jmd:qualityEvaluationType.description: links to reference docs for evaluation method should be in here. The methods should be mapped to the ISO19157 Evaluation method subtypes if possible; these include AggregationDerivation, IndirectEvaluation, SampleBAsedInspection, and FullInspection

jmd:qualityEvaluationMethodDescription.description: text description of the evaluation method

jmd:qualityEvaluationProcedure.description: text description of procedure used to implement evaluation method

jmd:qualityResultScopeItems.description: list of references to items that the result applies to

jmd:quantitativeResultValue.description: value may be single number or a list of numbers or strings

jmd:quantitativeResultType.description: if value is a structured text string (implementing a record structure),link from concept URI should access a description of the record.

jmd:UsageConstraintObject.description: properties for specifying legal, technical or security restrictions on the usage or distribution of a resource. Use for DPLA rights properties.

jmd:constraintsStatement.description: free text description of legal, technical, and security-related constraint on access to or use of a resource

jmd:constraints.description: list of all constraints on usage, each categorized by type (security, legal, technical) and specific instance of that constraint type using a controlled vocabulary. Any necessary text elucidation of the constraints should be in the constraintsStatement element

jmd:constraintType.description: category of constraint e.g.security, access, technical, usage.

jmd:constraintTerm.description: a controlled concept that specifies the particular constraint within the domain of constraints specified by the constraintType; e.g. ISO19115 codelists

jmd:licenses.description: specification of one or more licenses that applies to the resource. Complete statement of license should be put in the constraintsStatement key if it is desired to include in the metadata

jmd:licenseURI.description: identifier for the license. should derfenrnce to some kind of statement of license

jmd:licenseName.description: Name used to identify the license to users

jmd:dataSchemas.description: link to one or more resources describing the data schema

jmd:dataSetEntities.description: implements FGDC CSDGM entity-attribute section, and ISO19110 feature catalog. Array includes an entity count to indicate the number of instances of this entity in the described dataset instance

jmd:EntityObject.description: entity and attributes in the entity; ISO19110, ISO11179, FGDC entity - attribute information. Construct here describes concrete entities only.  NOTE: see also JSON Table Schema spec at http://dataprotocols.org/json-table-schema/#schema (TBD)

jmd:entityReference.description: Reference.URI is used to link the entity defnition to other information. The entity defintion my be include by reference to an external resource.

jmd:entityType.description: feature dataset(collection of related geographic entities unified by spatial reference), relational table, object... Need to identify a good vocabulary of entity types. This is to bridge content models between ISO19110, ISO11179, and FGDC CSDGM

jmd:entityName.description: name of feature class, table,or other entity manifestation

jmd:entityAliases.description: alternate names for labeling the entity in UI; use context property to select aliases for particular communities or target UI

jmd:entityAliasContext.description: identify the context in which the alias is used

jmd:memberEntities.description: compound entity like a feature dataset may have several included entities(lines and polys that have topological relationships). Don't try to model inheritance of properties in this scheme, denormalize and include references to repeated properties.

jmd:entityAttributes.description: basic properties to characterize attributes included in an entity content model. JSON $ref key can be used to link definition to a registered attribute definition. The propertySpecified property is used for semantic integration

jmd:attributeName.description: name of attribute specific to context of this entity

jmd:attributeDescription.description: description of how the attribute is meant to be used

jmd:attributeAliases.description: alternate names for labeling the entity in UI; use context property to select aliases for particular communities or target UI

jmd:attributeAliasContext.description: identify the context in which the alias is used

jmd:attributePropertySpecified.description: The phenomenon quantified by the attribute, e.g.length, mass, concept, velocity.The value here will be related to the valid UOM for the value.

jmd:attributeDataType.description: logical data type for attribute; 0..1, integer, float, text, URI, reference...

jmd:attributeDomain.description: specifiction of restrictions on the range of values that may be used to quantify the specified property in this entity

jmd:entitySpatialReferenceSystem.description: SRS for feature class; only needs to be specified if have composite feature catalog for the dataset and feature classes using more that one SRS are included. If all uses one SRS, then the spatialResolution Property for the dataset is sufficient

jmd:entitySpatialTopologyType.description: term specifying the topology type, i.e. the suite of relationships between feature that is enforced in the data

jmd:entityGeometryType.description: the geometry of features in the entity: point, line, polygon, voxel

jmd:entityResolution.description: specification of resolution, either as a scale denominator, or as a distance(with unit of measure) specifying the smallest distance in the Earth between resolvable points in the data

jmd:resolutionDenominator.description: resolution of spatial data specified as the design scale denominator for protrayal of the data.

jmd:resolutionDistanceValue.description: resolution of spatial data specified as the minimum distance between resolvable locations in the location data

jmd:ServiceDetailsObject.description: for metadata describing a service, the distribution section should include links to service end point URLs that will provide the service - specific self description document, e.g.THREDDS catalog, OGC GetCapabilities, OpenSearchDescription, WSDL, WADL, etc. This detail section allows linking to datasets exposed by the service, generic description of the operations provided by the service, and any important bindings between datasets and operations.It is anticipated that in most cases, this information will be gleaned from the service self - description document. Links to datasets are useful for discovery of services exposing particular datasets (which may be unknown to the dataset originator or metadata record creator)

jmd:serviceResources.description: specification of operations provided by service, resources that the service might or must (depending on the coupling type) use, and binding between particular service operations and particular resources (if applicable). If no operation is specified, the implication is that all operations can be targeted at the specified operatesOn resource (with the specified coupling).

jmd:resourceCouplingType.description: term that indicates whether this is a loose or tight coupling. Loose coupling means operation can be performed using other data provided by client. Tight coupling mean operation will always use the coupled resource.Loosely coupled resources might be indicated to provide examples for testing.

jmd:serviceOperatesOnReferences.description: specifies one or more resources that can be an input for the operation. In a tightly coupled service, this may be the only input resoruce that is available. For loosely coupled services, this element may identify one or more resources that can be used as input.

jmd:serviceOperations.description: specifies an operation that is tightly coupled to the dataset specified by serviceOperatesOn attribute in this coupled resource element.

jmd:serviceDescriptionLinks.description: links to resources related to the service, typically should include a link to a service description document as specified by the service definition; this might be an OGC capabilities document, WSDL, WADL, Hydra, Siren etc. document.

jmd:ServiceOperationObject.description: properties to sepcify the operations offered by a service

jmd:serviceOperation.description: name, identifier and links to registered operation; identifies the operation for interoperabiltiy and service composition workflows

jmd:serviceOperationTypes.description: one or more controlled terms that categorize the kind of operation to assist search/discovery

jmd:serviceOperationInvocationName.description: name used to invoke operation in the context of the service

jmd:serviceOperationDescription.description: free text description of what operation does

jmd:serviceOperationInvocationLink.description: one or more links for invoking operation. For metadata describing a service instance this would be an actual link template. For a generic description of a service, it might be a template for the URL segment after the host name. Recommended practice is to construct as a URI template (see http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6570).

jmd:parameterDescription.description: description of how to use parameter

jmd:coverageGridDescription.description: text description of coverage gridding scheme

jmd:CoverageGridDimensions.description: count of the number of coordinates that define each grid cell

jmd:coverageDimensions.description: 1..N one instance for each coverage dimension

jmd:coverageGeoreferencingDescription.description: text description of how coverage grid is or may be georeferenced

jmd:coverageGeoreferenceStatus.description: Term to indicate the status of a coverage with respect to establishing georeferencing. Includes e.g. {georeferencable, georectified, georeferenced...}, for coverage that  could be georeferenced, coverage that is georectified such that grid points are regularly located in a geographic coordinate system, georefenced means that information is included with the coverage (e.g. file header or world file) that defines mapping between coverage grid and geographic location.

jmd:DimensionObject.description: attributes to characterize a variable dimension in a coverage or grid.

jmd:dimensionRegularOrIrregular.description: term characterizing whether sample spacing on grid dimention is regularly spaced or irregular

jmd:dimensionSampleSpacing.description: spacing of samples on this dimension; if spacing is irregular, this is mean spacing

jmd:dimensionProperty.description: reference that specifies the phenomonon quantified on this coverage dimension

jmd:dimensionDomain.description: explanation of value domain for this axis

jmd:imageIlluminationElevationAngle.description: illumination elevation measured in degrees clockwise from the target plane at intersection of the optical line of sight with the Earth's surface. For images from a scanning device, refer to the centre pixel of the image

jmd:imageIlluminationAzimuthAngle.description: illumination azimuth measured in degrees clockwise from true north at the time the image is taken. For images from a scanning device, refer to the centre pixel of the image

jmd:imageCompressionGenerationQuantity.description: count of the number of lossy compression cycles performed on the image

jmd:imageRadiometricCalibration.description: identifier for resource representing a particular calibration event. Use reference because same calibration may be used over many images. Use nil/nilReason to explicitly document missing or unknown values.

jmd:imageCameraCalibration.description: identifier for resource representing a particular calibration event. Use reference because same calibration may be used over many images. Use nil/nilReason to explicitly document missing or unknown values.

jmd:imageFilmDistortionInformation.description: identifier for resource representing a particular description of film distortion. Use reference because same inforamtion may be used over many images. Use nil/nilReason to explicitly document missing or unknown values.

jmd:imageLensDistortionInformation.description: identifier for resource representing description of distortion for a particular lense. Use reference because same lens characterization may be used over many images. Use nil/nilReason to explicitly document missing or unknown values.

jmd:SoftwareObject.description: this should be considered a rough draft of what might be useful...

jmd:softwareHarwareRequirements.description: text describing necessary hardware environment for software to execute

jmd:softwareOperationPreconditions.description: text description of input requirements and state necessary to start execution

jmd:LinkObject.description: used for situations that need a link (hypermedia affordance) to an online resource, typically for navigating linked data space.  The link is a locator--an identifier for a location that can provide a digital object.

jmd:linkURL.description: a web-derferencable identifier that locates the link target; typically an HTTP URI. URI syntax specifies that the identifier string includes a prefix that specifies the base protocol for the identifier

jmd:linkRelations.description: Term from IANA rel vocabulary for consistency with IETF5988. Specifies relationship between resources. Use to assign semantics to the relationship between the linked resources.

jmd:relLabel.description: text to identify the reference in a UI

jmd:relVocabularyURI.description: identifier for vocabulary in which the relLabel is defined.

jmd:linkTitle.description: text to label this link in a UI

jmd:linkTargetResourceType.description: typically use MIME type string from IANA registry http : //www.iana.org/assignments/media-types/application/index.html. This is the type of the file that will be accessed directly by the link URL; if this is a container file (e.g. zip archive), the innerResourceType property is used to specify the type of file with actual resource content.

jmd:linkContentResourceType.description: File type for the actual resource content. Typically use MIME type string from IANA registry http : //www.iana.org/assignments/media-types/application/index.html

jmd:linkOverlayAPI.description: Reference that identifies the API for messages tunneled to a component on the target server.  Optional, provide if such scheme or protocol is necessary to utilize the link. The URI should be defined by the service specification for the protocol or service type; version information should be included if applicable.  E.g. OGC WMS, WS-services. This property is typically used for services that encode remote procedure calls using identifiers dereferenced using standard HTTP methods (GET, POST).

jmd:APILabel.description: text to identify the overlay API in a UI

jmd:linkProfile.description: Identifier for profile of specifications identified by type, overlayAPI, and template attributes. Optional, provide if additional conventions are necessary for content contained in messages through this link. Note that the same output scheme might be encoded using different types. Profiles typically add usage conventions when the interchange scheme offers alternate approaches, restrict cardinality for elements in the interchange format, or specify usage of particular vocabularies.

jmd:profileLabel.description: text to identify the profile in a UI

jmd:linkParameters.description: a dictionary (key-value pairs) of other paramters or properties that need to be associated with the link, e.g. WFS feature typeNames, WMS layer names

jmd:linkParameterLabel.description: string to display, and identifier to link parameter to registry

jmd:linkParameterURI.description: identifier for the parameter from a controlled vocabulary

jmd:linkDescription.description: free text description of the target to help UI

jmd:linkTransferSize.description: advisory length of the linked content in octets

jmd:ReferenceObject.description: Use when a linked resource is intended to be the value of some element; The URI is proxy for that resource and is thus required. Text-based comparison of identifiers can be used to test equivalence. Use when a global identifier is required for interoperability. The associated links are for advertising specific representations and other related resources. Some of these are likely to be accessible by dereferencing the URI, but the link elements allow explicit indication of the available representations and how to get them (with no URI redirection...)

jmd:referenceLabel.description: text to identify the reference in a UI

jmd:referenceLinks.description: Links to representation of some referenced resource

jmd:ControlledConceptObject.description: element to provide link to a concept that is defined in some vocabulary. A conceptURI value is hightly recommended, but in the name of keeping things simple, only a prefLabel is required. This is basically equivalent to a reference to a concept that allows a lazy approach simply providing a word (the prefLabel). If a vocabularyURI is provided, the prefLabel should be unique within that vocabulary, so the vocabularyURI and PrefLabel provide a unique compound identifier.  For ISO19115 codelist values, the prefLabel is the codeListValue, vocabularyURI is the codelist, and conceptAltLabel is the element value text (if you want something different than the codelist value.

jmd:conceptPrefLabel.description: This should be in the language specified by metadataLanguage

jmd:conceptAltLabels.description: alternate labels for the concept. Use JSON-LD language encoding for differrnt languages. The contexct property defines a scope or application for which the label is more appropriate. Use to customize labeling for particular interfaces and communities.

jmd:conceptAltLabelContext.description: text that defines a context for use of this label

jmd:vocabularyURI.description: identifier for the containing vocabulary (thesaurus, ontology...). Analogous to codelist in ISO19115 or codespace in GML.

jmd:conceptLinks.description: 0..N can provide various links to get related concepts, definitions, source, etc. Link/linkRelation properties can encode the standard SKOS type relationships between concepts.

jmd:AgentRoleObject.description: This object represents one person-organization affiliation, can be used with just organization. Requirement that can't be enforced via json schema is that there must be at least one personName, personPosition or organizationName, and there must be at least one phoneNumber or contactEmail.

jmd:AgentObject.description: This object represents one person-organization affiliation, can be used with just organization or an unaffiliated person. There must be at least one personName, personPosition or organizationName, and there must be at least one phoneNumber or contactEmail.

jmd:personPosition.description: identifies an individual who currently holds the named position in context of an organization

jmd:personLinks.description: additional details about an individual are in linked resources; this spec makes no provision, but suggest using FOAF properties

jmd:organizationNames.description: an array of synonyms used to identify an organization; put alternate spellings, abbreviations, and acronyms here

jmd:organizationLinks.description: Links to additional information about the organization, e.g. a home page; one of these should be for an icon to represent the organization

jmd:phoneLabel.description: Descriptive name of the phone number.

jmd:phoneNumber.description: Telephone number. Recommended format is to use 'x' or 'ext' to denote extensions.

jmd:phoneServices.description: Type(s) of phone number, e.g. voice, sms.

jmd:contactAddress.description: postal address,ideally formatted appropriate to the target country. One field because there is no clear reason to disaggregate the address into street, city, country, postal code, etc...

jmd:ExtentObject.description: schema for documenting geographic footprint of a described resource. Constraint: at least one of extentReference, boundingBoxWGS84, extentGeometry or verticalExtent MUST have a valid value. Gazeteer place names should be included as keywords with keyword type = 'place'. Point location should be represented using geoJSONgeometry

jmd:extentGeometryTypes.description: category concept to specify the relationship of the extent to the geographic footprint of the resource, use to distinguish whether the geometry encompasses an area covered by the data or an area where data is not present, or if a point location is provided whether that is a centroid or actual resource location. Allow multiple values.

jmd:extentLabel.description: string to label this extent in UI

jmd:extentReference.description: extent could be referenced, but only useful in a system that could follow links to access the actual geometry, or for which the URI is sufficient to match locations.

jmd:boundingBoxesWGS84.description: simplest representation of geographic extent using latitude and longitude coordinates. Points are represented as degenerate boxes (east = west, north = south bound). Mandate WGS 84 for interoperability. For boxes in polar regions, recommend using geometry property, which allows specification of other SRS appropriate to polar region. Bounding box is assumed to contain the area to which the data apply (i.e. not exclusion).

jmd:extentGeometry.description: allow arbitrary geometry object to specify extent. Use GeoJSON encoding. Schema by fge on Github

jmd:verticalExtent.description: Maximum and Minimum Elevations are relative to a datum elevation (based on vertical CRS), which will typically be the Earth surface at the location of the resource or sea level. Datum Elevation must be reported relative to mean sea level (MSL) in meters using EPSG::5714 geodetic parameters (WGS 84). Datum type must be a controlled vocabulary (Earth surface, MSL, Kelly bushing, etc.). The maximum is always numerically greater than the minimum elevation. For boreholes with datum at the earth surface, depth below surface is reported as a negative number.  *Vertical extent may be reported relative to different datum (e.g. sea level, Earth surface) in the same record.  Example: core from borehole at depths between 100 and 470 feet, borehole collar at 4787 feet above sea level.

jmd:EventDateObject.description: this is a base data type for calendar dates; may be used as the value for various properties. Extensions may define other schems for recording calendar, e.g. Julian, other calendars, etc.

jmd:eventTypes.description: 0..N  event may be categorized in various ways...

jmd:ValueDomainObject.description: choice of one of the following elements:

jmd:controlledVocabulary.description: attribute value is restricted to terms from a vocabulary (pick list)

jmd:targetEntity.description: The attribute value is a link to another entity (foreign key). The URI identifies the target entity type definition, and the reference links should enable access to the linked resource in a specific instance.

jmd:stringLength.description: if datatype is text, max length of text string

jmd:TimeInstantObject.description: this is only necessary if thre is a requiremnt to have description text associated with the position, or if the position has an identifier

jmd:timeInstantId.description: A unique identifier for the timeInstant.

jmd:timeInstantDescription.description: A brief description providing relevant information about the date and time.

jmd:TimePeriodObject.description: A span of time represented by a starting date-time and an ending date-time.

jmd:timePeriodId.description: A unique identifier for a time period.

jmd:timePeriodDescription.description: A brief description providing relevant information about the time period.

jmd:timePeriodBeginPosition.description: Starting date, or date and time.

jmd:timePeriodEndPosition.description: Ending date, or date and time.

jmd:languageCode.description: Language of content. Default is eng if no value is specified.

jmd:LineageObject.description: Summary statements for processing steps in resource processing; used to document metadata provenance as well as resource provenance; detailed provenance history might be recorded in a separate provenance database using a Prov schema, a link is provided to access this history. This schema allows construction of the history using processing steps described by statements, or as complete ISO19115 Lineage/processStep elements.

jmd:stepSequenceNo.description: integer provided to sort processing steps in chronologic order. If an ISO19115 LI_Lineage/statement is provided, the stepSequenceNo SHOULD be '0'

jmd:processStepStatement.description: if History (lineage) is described by a sequence of processing steps (ISO 19115 LI_Lineage/processStep), this maps to the LI_ProcessStep/description. If other processing step content elements are present, use the full #Lineage construct (see choice 3 in this array definition). If an ISO19115 LI_Lineage/statement is provided in the source metadata, that should be the first (stepSequenceNo = 0) processStepStatement element content

jmd:provenanceLink.description: a link to a provenance resource maintained externally; provides a URL that will retrieve the complete provenance trace for this record from the PROV service

jmd:processStep.description: an inline ISO19115 LI_ProcessStep object encoded in JSON.
